page.title: 16 BETLEY COURT
page.content: Betley Court is occupied by Professor Brown,his wife and students who live in 10 flats he converted from the main building in the late 1970's.He bought the Court in 1977 because he thought it was an interesting building.He moved there in 1978.Big alterations have been made since he moved in,including costly roof repairs.There are 10 rooms in the house,and none are disused. Betley Court was built in 1716 as a home for the Fletcher Twemlow family,a hospital and a rehabilitation centre.Prof. Brown says there are no secret passage ways,ghosts or secret stairways.Prof. Brown also runs an antique gallery.In the gallery he has a replica of the "Betley window" which is the oldest picture of morris dancers in Britain and is from the 1500Â£s and in 1981 it was depicted on a stamp.
